climbs.name: Waist Deep
climbs.fa: H. B.,  D. R.,  L. O.

content.description:
P1. Climb easy terrain to a thin hand crack. Follow this to its end. When possible, make a traverse left to a huge flake. Follow it to a weakness that leads to a ledge. Build a belay here, 120', 5.10 (PG-13).

P2. Climb double cracks to a ledge, 60', 5.8+.

P3. Climb a shallow, right-facing corner. When possible, step left to a left-facing corner. Follow it to the top, 70', 5.9.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" and doubles up to 2".
content.location: On the left center of the wall, locate a shallow hand crack in a weakness that leads to a huge flake.

content.description:
P1. Follow a crack system up an arete to a sloping ledge, 100 feet, 5.8.

P2. From a sloping ledge, step right to a sharp arete, place some tricky, thin pro, and make a techy move to gain the arete. Follow it to a ledge with a block. Climb a shallow corner behind a block to a ledge. Build an anchor here, 100 feet, 5.8+ (at the start of this pitch, there is a escape out left).

P3. Climb a crack system through a roof, and follow cracks to the top, 50 feet, 5.7.
content.protection: A single rack 00 to 4", and doubles of 0.3"-2" would be useful.
content.location: Climb vertical cracks on a sharp looking arete on the far left side of The Wall.

content.description:
P1. Climb easy rock to a right-facing flake. Follow it up to a ledge with a bolt and a cam placement. Build a belay here.

P2. Climb a tips crack past two bolts and a numerous gear placements to a bolted anchor just below a roof.
content.protection: A single rack 00 to 3", and doubles of 0.2'-.4' may be useful.
content.location: In center of the wall, locate a clean, right-facing flake (you might be able to see the bolts on the second pitch just above the start).

content.description: Climb a slab to double flakes. Follow a wide crack to the top (tree anchor).
content.location: This is just around the corner on the left side of The Wall.

content.description:
P1. Climb a weakness to a ledge, traverse left, and follow a crack to its end. Here traverse left (around an arete) to a right-facing corner. Follow it to a great belay ledge, 5.8, 100'.

P2. Climb through the left side of a roof, and follow an arete up to a sloping ledge, 5.9, 50'.

Descent: rappel via fixed gear or finish route and use descent gully.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" with doubles of 0.3"-2".
content.location: It is on the left side of The Wall. Start at the base of a massive, right-facing corner.

content.description:
P1. Climb easy terrain for 15', then traverse right to a hand crack.. Follow it to a ledge. Build an anchor here, 100', 5.8.

P2. Climb easy terrain to a shallow, right-facing corner. Climb it, and transfer to the left-facing corner above it. This will eventually lead to a nice ledge with a right-facing corner. Build an anchor here, 80', 5.10.

P3. Traverse out right on a horizontal (Tricams useful), and make a bouldery move past a 0.4 placement in a slot (*don't miss) to gain a left-trending ramp. Follow this ramp to a right-facing corner. Climb this corner (the crux -leader aided through two moves but second freed it) to easier terrain, and build an anchor here, 80', 5.11.

P4. Climb easy terrain to the top ledge, 5.6, 40'.
content.protection: A single rack to 4" and doubles of 0.1"-2" (triples of red c3/blue TCU would be useful for the crux).
content.location:
It is in the center of the wall (do the same start as

Lost In Cougar Town

, then climb out right).
